pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:0.5: 24. The training rule on moving the robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.2: At that time the nuns stored one of their robes with other nuns and then left to wander the country in a sarong and an upper robe.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.3: Because they were stored for a long time, the robes became moldy.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.4: When the nuns put them out to sun them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.7: And they told them what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.8: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.9: “How can nuns store one of their robes with other nuns and then go wandering the country in a sarong and an upper robe?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.10: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.15: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:1.16.1: ‘If a nun does not move her robes for more than five days, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.5: Does not move her robes for more than five days:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.1.6: if she does not wear or sun her five robes on the fifth day, then, when the fifth day has passed, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.1: If it is more than five days, and she perceives it as more, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.2: If it is more than five days, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.3: If it is more than five days, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.4: If it is less than five days, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.5: If it is less than five days, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.2.6: If it is less than five days and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.2: if she wears or suns the five robes on the fifth day;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc24:2.3.7: The fourth training rule is finished.
